definitions.definition: To make contact (with someone) while in proximity.

subdefinitions.definition: To come face to face with by accident ; to encounter .
examples: Fancy meeting you here! Guess who I met at the supermarket today?

subdefinitions.definition: To come face to face with someone by arrangement.
examples: Let's meet at the station at 9 o'clock.
I'm pleased to meet you! I'd like you to meet a colleague of mine.
I met my husband through a mutual friend at a party. It wasn't love at first sight; in fact, we couldn't stand each other at first!
José, I don't think you've met my friend Maria.

subdefinitions.definition: To gather for a formal or social discussion; to hold a meeting .
examples: I met with them several times. The government ministers met today to start the negotiations.
England and Holland will meet in the final.

definitions.definition: To make physical or perceptual contact.

subdefinitions.definition: To converge and finally touch or intersect .
examples: The two streets meet at a crossroad half a mile away.

subdefinitions.definition: To touch or hit something while moving.
examples: The right wing of the car met the column in the garage, leaving a dent.
The carpet meets the wall at this side of the room. The forest meets the sea along this part of the coast.

subdefinitions.definition: To respond to (an argument etc.) with something equally convincing; to refute .

examples: This proposal meets my requirements. The company agrees to meet the cost of any repairs.

definitions.definition: To balance or come out correct.
To perceive; to come to a knowledge of; to have personal acquaintance with; to experience; to suffer.
examples: The eye met a horrid sight. He met his fate.

definitions.definition: To be mixed with, to be combined with aspects of.

main_definition: To make contact (with someone) while in proximity.
secondary_definitions: To make physical or perceptual contact.
( intransitive ) To balance or come out correct.
To perceive; to come to a knowledge of; to have personal acquaintance with; to experience; to suffer.
To be mixed with, to be combined with aspects of.
